quest.name: A Far Eastern Yarn
journal: A familiar beeping noise is emitting from the curious courier.

Noticing its excited beeping noises, you speak with the curious courier, who informs you that Tataru is on her way with mysterious guests in tow once more. The ecstatic mammet directs you to await her arrival on the islet inlet.

You do not have to wait long before Tataru arrives on the beach with Cirina and Sadu at her side. The pair inform you that they have begun a tour of Eorzea at Lyse's suggestion, to behold all it has to offer now that some semblance of peace has settled throughout the realm. As they have come all this way, Tataru suggests that you show the pair around the island, to which you agree with a characteristic nod. After an extensive examination of the local sheep, they seem well satisfied, and offer you a souvenir from the Azim Steppe─traditional garments adjusted for warm climes. With the island once more to yourself, you may focus wholeheartedly on its continued development.
objectives: Await Tataru's arrival at the designated location.

dialogue.name: OPERATORMAMMET
dialogue.text: Contact! Contact from Mistress Tataru!

dialogue.name: OPERATORMAMMET
dialogue.text: She's sent word that she's headed this way, and with guests once again! If you wait on the inlet to the west, she should come into view in no time!

dialogue.name: OPERATORMAMMET
dialogue.text: I can't believe it happened again!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Forename!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Thanks for coming out to meet us!

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: It is good to see you well, Forename. Please forgive us for coming uninvited.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: We are given to understand that this beautiful isle is your domain, and you have taken to farming, foraging, and erecting quaint monoliths?

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: You claim dominion over tiny ironmen, they say. That, at least, is befitting of a khagan.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: ...But you are doubtless curious as to how we came to know all of this. In truth, it was Lyse who first invited me to tour Eorzea. She told me of the many wonderful things that I have yet to see in this land─sights as beautiful as those found in the Steppe.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Lyse's hands are unfortunately full with her duties in Gyr Abania, however, so I offered to show off the realm's hottest sights. And there's nothing hotter than an island paradise!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: And you two opted to journey together?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Where's our “little sun”?

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: Our previous visits to this realm have been under the shadow of war. We both wished to take this opportunity to see what joys it has to offer.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: Cirina had a mind to journey alone at first.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: I knew trouble would find her, so I invited myself along. With luck, we may encounter an adversary who offers us sport.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: ...Pardon? Do you mean Magnai?

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: Ah, if you wish to see him, you should find him at the Dawn Throne, as ever. I regret to say that I may have neglected to invite him...

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: She much prefers my company to that of the preening fool.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: Now that we are here, I should quite like to see the pasture you mentioned, Mistress Tataru.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: Oh, and the wild sheep roaming the isle! I must know if they are as replete with wool as those on the Steppe...

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Why not show them around yourself, Forename? That way, they can get a close and personal look at everything your sanctuary has to offer.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: If it's truly no bother, we would be delighted!

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: How enlightening! To think sheep can thrive in so remote a place as this...

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: Those inhabiting this isle do appear somewhat lean, with perhaps less fleece or fat than those of the Steppe. Yet they seem content with their grazing habits, different though their fodder may be. I cannot thank you enough for the opportunity to meet them.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: You have fertile land here. A fine domain─if only it weren't so insufferably humid. I see now why Cirina insisted on these fabrics.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, we brought you something!

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: These garments are of the traditional style, but I did my utmost to make them suitable for hotter climes. I hope you will find them to your liking.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: We had best be on our way now, but we thank you for the gracious hospitality you have shown us.

dialogue.name: SADU
dialogue.text: You would be wise to invite us again. I will prepare a Dotharli gift.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Each time I visit, I'm amazed by what you've accomplished here. I can't wait to see what else you've achieved when next I return!
